News Projects Publications FaBlog EnBlog Resume

Mohammadhossein Salari

I am a doctoral researcher at the Interactive Technologies Research Group, University of Eastern Finland. My current work involves implementing and assessing eye-tracking technology in challenging real-world environments, with the aim of developing effective and robust predictive gaze-based models in the wild. I am passionate about computer vision on edge devices and creating cost-effective eye-tracking solutions for everyday use.

Recent Projects

View All

Fenjan

A bot that finds Ph.D. positions from social media and university websites, delivering daily personalized updates.

arXivSquirrel

A Go program that creates personalized RSS feeds from arXiv.org based on your research keywords.

Automatically extracting the optic disc area in fundus images

A project that automates the detection of optic discs in fundus images to assist with glaucoma screening.
